summary: Oropharyngeal cancer is a type of head and neck cancer that affects the oral cavity and the part of the throat including the base of the tongue, tonsils, soft palate, and pharyngeal walls. It can grow locally and spread to other parts of the body. It is classified into HPV-positive and HPV-negative types.
causes: Oral human papillomavirus infection (for HPV-positive oropharyngeal cancer)
Use of alcohol (for HPV-negative oropharyngeal cancer)
Use of tobacco (for HPV-negative oropharyngeal cancer)
risk_factors: Performing open-mouthed kissing or oral/mouth-genital sex on a person with a human papillomavirus infection
Diet low in fruit and vegetables
symptoms: Sore throat that persists for over 2 weeks
Lump in the back of the throat or mouth
diagnosis: Biopsy of observed abnormal tissue in the throat
Genetic and chromosomal testing (for P53 mutation and CDKN2A mutations)
Staging according to appearance of abnormal cells on biopsy, dimensions, and extent of abnormal cells
